And also, BYO!

poi.name: Tria Cafe Wash West
poi.text:
We came here after dinner for some post-dinner drinks, but ended up ordering some cheese and dessert as well. We asked the server for some recommendations that would pair well with our drinks - and she was spot on! 

I would say that the only con about this place is that it is on the smaller side, and the seating is slightly cramped, but the awesome servers, classy-but-not-too-persnickety decor, and choice of food/wine are definitely worth it!

PS. if you want to end with something sweet, try their banana panino! Doesn't sound like much, but I ended up eating my boyfriend's share of it too.

poi.name: Southgate
poi.text:
Maybe it's because I am a frequent diner of Korean cuisine, but all this place seemed like to me was overpriced Korean fusion food in a "hip" setting. Honestly, if you don't eat Korean food EVER then this place will be AMAZING to you. The place is clean and sleek, the chicken wings are bomb, and bibimbap is not an item that is easily accessible in center city. But if you are like me and regularly eat Korean food, $2 per wing, $3 for fermented cabbage that usually comes free, and ~$15 for a bowl of rice and veggies in a stone bowl are just not worth it.
On the plus side, at least this place is helping Korean food become more mainstream.

poi.name: Rittenhouse Grill
poi.text:
The general consensus about this place: Juicy, well seasoned prime rib, but with an overly pretentious atmosphere and mediocre service. 

We had a reservation for 7:00, but wasn't seated until 7:30. We weren't the one only ones waiting, either; there were 2 groups in front of us who had reservations for 6:30, but didn't get seated until 7:20. What's the point of making reservations if you're going to have to wait almost an HOUR?

Finally, we were led to an open dining area with live piano playing. I was enjoying the classy atmosphere, but was abruptly startled by the brashness of our server. The only two reasons for his demeanor can either be because he was new, or because just did not give a care in the world. By this point, the service was earning 2 stars. Either way, he quickly ruined my temporarily uplifted mood.

I ordered roasted tomato soup for appetizer, which tasted like plain marinara sauce. As I was beginning to seriously doubt my choice to dine here, the redeemer of this whole place finally arrived:THE PRIME RIB. Juicy, seasoned, with the perfect amount of fat. 

This hefty chunk of meat alone would give this place 4.5 stars (slightly overcooked), but the service brings this place to a 3. I generously round up to a 4 because despite the rudeness of this place they call service, this is a prime rib you won't want to miss.

poi.name: Temple University Hospital
poi.text:
I had to make an apoointment 2 months in advance to get seen. Prior to arrival, I asked that I not be seen by any students and wanted to see the doctor right away. 
They assured me that would be the case. 

First off, when I got here, I got sent on a scavenger hunt to find Dr. Simoncini. I literally went to 3 different buildings across 5 floors to find my doctor. When I finally arrived (out of breath) at the correct office, I ended up waiting for 30 minutes, got sent a 4th year medical student who interviewed me for 30 minutes, then I waited another 30 minutes, and got asked the SAME exact questions by Dr. Simoncini. Great, thanks for making me wait an hour just to repeat myself.

Then I got sent to the lab for bloodwork, and you guessed it, waited another 30 minutes.

A grand total of 2.5 hours for a visit with the doctor that resulted with only TWENTY minutes of face time with an ACTUAL doctor. My insurance is paying a lot for a whole lot of nothing.

poi.name: El Camino Real
poi.text:
Service: super slow. Our hostess was pleasant, but our server was straight up RUDE.

Food: I got one of the specials - seared ahi tuna burrito. First of all, it wasn't even a burrito; it was 2 tiny cold flour tortillas with tiny pieces of mushy tuna inside. seared? tasted like it was microwaved.

bill: $70 for 4 unsatisfied people.

poi.name: Temple University Hospital
poi.text:
I have now switched doctors due to the inefficiency of this place. But, I'm still getting stupid charges and dealing with nonsense forms because people in this office can't do their jobs correctly. I have dealt with numerous rude nurse and incompetent secretaries who all have no idea what they're doing there. 

If ever in an emergency, I'd rather die on the streets than come here... because ultimately in the end I'll probably die anyway at their lack of knowledge and care and be charged thousands of dollars for it.

poi.name: Las Cazuelas Restaurant BYOB
poi.text: Your authentic Mexican restaurant with nice service. Prices are slightly above average, but the decor, plating, and ambiance are also slightly above average. BYO!

poi.name: Smiley's Cafe
poi.text: Authentic Mediterranean food for a decent price! Friendly staff, with the option of various smoothies to complement!

poi.name: Prohibition Taproom
poi.text: GREAT decor, friendliest staff ever, craft beers on draft and bottle, and draft beers are reasonably priced. Whenever there is original sin cider, that is what I choose, and never have I ever had to pay only $5 for it at a bar. GO prohibition taproom!

poi.name: Good Karma Cafe
poi.text: This place is the perfect place if you want to get some work done! Plenty of space, wi-fi, and separated rooms. High quality drinks to accompany your high quality work! Wouldn't recommend this place to catch up with a friend though - I came once with a friend I haven't seen in a while and I definitely got some dirty looks from hard workers sitting nearby

poi.name: Let's Cultivate Food
poi.text: Mike and Yoon are wonderful people, had a great time trying and learning different things.  Nice intimate setting, very relaxed and enjoyable.  They make cooking a blast! Learned new techniques that I would've never known without coming here!

poi.name: Cedar Park Cafe
poi.text:
Your neighborhood diner! I actually have a hard time finding good yet simple cafes/diners, but this is it! I always order chicken and waffles, and the chicken never fails to be crispy! I've had almost everything here now on the menu, from the wraps to the grits, and although it is not the most amazing food you'll ever have, you will leave happy, even with the bill :) 

PS. Apparently even Clinton has been here now?

poi.name: Federal Donuts
poi.text: I love federal donuts! And this place def makes them well! Why 3 stars? This location has SLOW service. Not because they're understaffed, not because they're busy, but because there is no oversight of the employees. While one worker was making donuts, refilling items, and taking orders, the other girl was chatting it up and flirting with one single customer. We were first in line when we entered, yet had to wait 25 minutes for our donuts because one worker was trying to get those digits while on the job. I would hate if she were my co-worker, and the other worker was obviously unhappy doing the job of 2 people.

poi.name: Han Dynasty
poi.text: I've been here multiple times now, but I always have the same thought: overpriced chinese food. Nothing great or horrible, really, but you can get the same kind of food in Chinatown for half the price. You're basically paying the extra other half for decor and English speaking servers (which, I guess is pretty important to most people).  If you are coming though, their fish dishes are worth ordering.

poi.name: Penang
poi.text:
Everything we had at this place was delicious!! We ordered the pancake appetizer, mango chicken, and a stewed beef curry dish that the waiter chose for us. The mango chicken was by far my favorite dish!! freshly cut mango perfectly grilled with chicken. The dish may seem a little pricey, but it's a pretty big plate of food.

I would have given this place five stars, but the service was a little slow. by the time our main dishes came out, our appetizers were cold. Still, the food is definitely worth the wait!

poi.name: Drexel Family Medicine - Tower Health
poi.text:
I have been here 3 times now and although I enjoy the convenience of this place, you have to remember this is a teaching facility so you only get med students who don't know jack diddly squat  and/or residents who will always have to double check everything with their attending. That being said, everything else is pretty disorganized. I witnessed someone's confidential information get switched with another patient's, so the office was in a disarray trying to sort that mess out. Also be prepared to wait an hour before they see you for your appointment. 

Money hungry people always also make you come three times for something that can be done in one visit so they can charge for 3 visits. US medical practice for you!

poi.name: Tsaocaa
poi.text:
A great new addition to Main St.! Not just a bubble tea store, but also froyo and some food items. This is my second Tsaocaa location I've tried, and this place is definitely cleaner with nicer service. 

Sorry, Tsaocaa, although you are not my favorite milk tea place (too watery for my taste), you do win when it comes to fruit tea in the city. 

Plus, this location sells freshly made chicken wings, somewhat korean fried chicken style! As in it will take a while for your order to come out because it is freshly fried and smothered in your choice of sauce. Soy garlic was pretty salty but still delicious.

poi.name: Cake Life Bake Shop
poi.text: Came here to order the latte listed on their specials menu. When ordered though, the server looked extremely confused. She looked at the menu, then looked at me, looked at the menu, looked back at me, and responded, "umm... sure, I guess I could make that." Not so comforting when I'm ordering a $6 drink, which in fact did come out tasting a bit odd. Maybe will come again to try their treats, but would not order drinks here again.

poi.name: Village Whiskey
poi.text:
This place is over hyped!

first of all, just getting burgers with cheese and fries will cost you just over $20. Now i dont mind paying $20 for a burger if it's worth it, and this place was not. Yeah the patty was juicier than the average burger, but everything else was mediocre; if you're going to charge $3 for cheese, at least make it a good slice of cheese. I would be giving this place more stars if it weren't so over priced for the quality. There's better burger places out there for much less. However, they did have a wide variety of whiskey options, but sadly for me, i came for the burger.

poi.name: Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams
poi.text: What a great new craft ice cream addition to the city! Yes, they are a bit pricey, but you are paying for quality and care. Coffee cream and sugar was my favorite flavor here. Perfectly creamy with a coffee kick.

poi.name: Mazzoni Center
poi.text:
I feel so comfortable with the Mazzoni Center.  I, and many others, am incredibly lucky and grateful that these services exist.  Going through all sorts of life challenges can be painful and frightening when you know you're assumed to be a certain way.  Here, there are no assumptions.  They know who they're working with, and they are sensitive without the need to pry for information.  If you're in need of gynecology and you're not a woman, for example, they know exactly how to handle your needs while prioritizing respect for your identity.

My biggest concern is the physical space in which the Mazzoni Center clinic exists.  I feel sort of exposed in the waiting room.  I hope that they someday have the funds to upgrade to a larger, more private space.

If you visit during youth drop-in hours rather than making an appointment, you will probably wait a very long time to see someone.  This is completely understandable, in my opinion.  They'll advise you regarding what time you should show up if you call.

Occasionally, I've noticed lapses in communication; I have been kept waiting in the exam room before with no one around and no idea how much longer I would have to wait.  This is not a common issue, and I find that, overall, I receive more attentive service here than at any other clinic I've visited.

Be aware that the doctor you want to speak with may not always be available over the phone.  Don't be afraid to leave messages with reception.  You'll always receive quick assistance.

poi.name: Axis Pizza
poi.text:
I like your food, Axis, I really do.  Unfortunately, I can not give you higher than three stars because you consistently fail to adhere to my instructions when I order from you.

Last time we ordered a pizza from Axis, we asked for all but one topping on the whole pizza, and the final topping on half of the pizza.  What we got instead was a half-plain pizza with all of the toppings on one side.  Whenever I order a pasta dish, I ask for croutons and extra dressing with my salad instead of green peppers and tomatoes.  What I get varies from "misread the instructions" to "completely failed to read the instructions at all".

Very frustrating.

poi.name: Cucina Zapata
poi.text:
These guys really deserve the five stars.  They work so hard.  Even if they put avocado on something when I ask for it without avocado, or if my veggie burger is slightly crisper than I'd like, I have to remember that they have dozens of customers lining up to order at any given time of day, and only a few people working in the truck.  Their food is consistently phenomenal, and they're such a friendly bunch of people!

The food is delicious; the veggie burger is my favorite in the whole city, especially because they top it off with cabbage alongside the lettuce and tomato.  It's a stroke of genius, in my opinion - the extra crunch elevates the whole burger.  I enjoy their spicy mayo on everything.  The vegetarian curry they occasionally have is pretty delicious; I love the flavor of the sweet potatoes.  I'd like to try the tilapia over rice sometime, and my coworkers think that their breakfast specials are phenomenal (although I can't eat any of their current specials).

I'd also like to reiterate how friendly the staff are at Cucina.  Seriously nice folks.

Be aware that there is a good chance that you'll be waiting for half an hour or longer for your food.  If you don't have that kind of time for lunch, don't come here and feel insulted when your food takes longer than you intended to wait.  They're working their butts off.  Additionally, they DO NOT take cards.  I mentioned this in the survey, but I think it's important to note here, too.

poi.name: Marrakesh
poi.text: I've been to half a dozen identical Moroccan restaurants, and they woo me every time.  Marrakesh edges out all the others on my list because of the small details: attentive service, extensive drink menu, perfectly-cooked food, intimate atmosphere.  Cash only, BYOB or buy drinks in the restaurant.  Come hungry.  Try the rose drink.

poi.name: New Number One Chinese Restaurant
poi.text: I meant to write this review a long time ago.  Quality has declined massively over the past couple of years.  Brief explanation: last time we ordered, the food arrived in 17 minutes.  It takes about 17 minutes (considering traffic) to drive from their location to ours.  Heaven only knows when they cooked the food they delivered to us that night.  Yikes.

poi.name: CVS Pharmacy
poi.text:
Ridiculous and incompetent. Some of the lower-level staff are friendly enough, but that dissipates quickly further up the chain. Watched one of the pharmacists unintentionally intimidate a woman out of getting a flu shot, overtalking & failing to check her social cues. Phone is frequently left unanswered. Was just on hold for over twenty minutes. I fell asleep with the phone at my ear.

And don't ever put my crap on autofill.

poi.name: New Number One Chinese Restaurant
poi.text:
I don't feel qualified to review this place.  I've only ordered delivery, and not very frequently either - but I felt inspired by the other poor reviews to say that my experience was fantastic.

Last night, I ordered General Tso's Tofu.  Compared to the innumerable tofu disasters I've experienced at other East-Asian restaurants, I thought it was excellently cooked!  The broccoli included was fresh and also well-cooked.  The portion was enormous, which explained why the price was a few dollars over what I was used to.  I had to order an extra portion of rice, since I knew their dishes come with far less rice than they should.  For the extra rice, it cost probably more than it should, but the carton was packed as full as it could be, so I oughtn't complain.

Boyd enjoyed his beef with broccoli, and Graham and Sean both enjoyed their respective fried rices.  I took advantage of the Grubhub coupon that got me a box of the world's most addictive substance - those fried Chinese donuts - and there were, like, twenty of them.  They were delicious.

The deliveryman was friendly and punctual.  I definitely intend to order from this restaurant again.  I am an incredibly nitpicky person, but even the hiccups listed above can't prevent me from giving this place a glowing review.

poi.name: New Delhi Indian Restaurant
poi.text:
I haven't ordered from New Delhi in a while because my last experience was incredibly disappointing.  I really loved the Paneer Makhni, once.  At the time, I was so thrilled that I had found an Indian restaurant that served it deliciously creamy and just spicy enough.

Recently, however, there has been a massive decline in quality.  A few weeks ago, I had a craving for paneer, and I managed to convince Boyd to try something different, so I ordered my usual paneer and naan, plus some chicken pakora.  Boyd enjoyed the pakora, but my paneer had a layer of grease on top that was so thick that I could dip a piece of naan into it and come up without any sauce.  It was flavorless - it even tasted like grease.  I'm also not happy about the mango lassi; it's little more than oversweetened milk with bright orange food coloring.

I really want to order from you guys again.  Please keep an eye on your quality control; your food is really good when you're paying attention.

poi.name: Termini Bros Bakery
poi.text: I had the carrot cake.... Very disappointed tasted like licorice and baking soda cooking powder. It's too bad because everything looks so delicious :( also didn't like the chocolate chips in it either.

poi.name: Termini Bros Bakery
poi.text: simply the best! everything from here is good! I come from a very Italian family and whenever there is a family event, there is always Termini brothers dessert trays! Their cannolis are amazing! Highly recommend.

poi.name: Queen Nails & Spa
poi.text: I came here on recommendation of a co-worker. They are a little more pricey that what I normally pay but was willing for a good nail salon. The first few times it went well, afterward the girls seemed rushed and the last time I was there my one whole hand nails is shorter than the other hand! With such a saturation of salons in the area its time to move on...

poi.name: Chuck E. Cheese
poi.text: I live right around here and I used to take my brother here when I babysat him all summer for an afternoon for something different. I almost had parents arguing with me and kids running wild asking me for tokens or trying to take our tickets! The manager always gave me a hard time coming here cause god forbid I wasnt the childs parent the food is horrible and their salad bar needs a review from the health department, stick to dave and busters at mills for good games...I will never return to this location.

poi.name: Forman Mills
poi.text: This store has pretty reasonably priced clothing..its a hunt looking through all the racks..I come closer to closing its pretty dead so I dont have to deal with seedy clientel. I never had a problem with employees and always had smooth transactions. I come here for inexpensive clothing or clothes I'm gonna wear a few times.

poi.name: Chick-fil-A
poi.text: I hate fast food, but this is the only fast food I eat. I usually come for lunch, sometimes its super crowded, sometimes its not but on the days that it is crowded, they make the line go really quick. I never had an issue with any of the employees, one time I wanted the grilled nuggets but I said the number of the fried nuggets but said I want them grilled instead (politely mind you), I got a rude" WELL THATS A DIFFERENT NUMBER".  Well I'M SORRY, I wanted grilled today, don't have a cow! I have the app where I can get free things after a few purchases, I will keep returning for waffle fries and awesomeness!

poi.name: Hammerheads Bar & Grille
poi.text: all the bars in the Mayfair area, this one my friends is the worse to me. Don't try coming here when its packed and expect to walk around freely and get a drink, I came here around st patty's day and walked right out, came here once on a random weekend and hated every second of being here. I could also count the amount of creeps who tried hitting on me as well. I enjoyed my pretzel-purchasing expirence at the soft pretzel factory 20 min later much better. Don't do it. You'll thank me.

poi.name: 7-Eleven
poi.text: its 7-11, its on campus and its pretty darn convenient! inexpensive coffee, inexpensive snacks, the only thing is they took away their fresh brewed tea when they got new coffee machines.They also NEVER had honey! I always had to bring my own honey. The serivce can be hit or miss  but their coffees always fresh and hot. Kudos to this location for serving Temple U's caffeine needs!

poi.name: The Edge Fitness Clubs
poi.text: I was a member here for a year. I really liked the spin classes, the gym itself was clean, well lit and great machines. The reason why I stopped going was because I got a new job further away from the gym. I originally joined this gym due to convenience of my old job. I told the person I signed up with and was told I could only cancel if I moved a certain distance away or medical reasons. Needless to say I paid dues to this gym for 6 months and I didnt even attend. I feel robbed. I just cancelled my contract with ABC fitness so hopefully there arent any further charges come Sept. I have to agree with some other comments you need more than a 3 day pass or offer monthly contracts instead.

poi.name: Saladworks
poi.text: This is my go-to saladworks location, the employees are always friendly and get the order right. Their food is always fresh and they always put fresh food out. They are also a very clean location which is the key in a place where there is salad. I order sophies salad, yum! It is even nice sitting in their dining area, I just wish they offered discounts for the Retro Fitness members since they share a shopping center and I always go there after my workout, but get the saladworks rewards card and earn points towards free food and sometimes theres is coupons in the local circulars which helps!

poi.name: Forever 21
poi.text: Go to this location if you have plenty of time to spare! I'm not kidding I was almost late to work because I was in here! Great clothing at great prices, I love their weekends when they have half off clearance sales I get so many deals those weekends! I just wish they had actual Black Fri deals, prepare to come in here to "just browse" leaving feeling nauseated, having a headache and your wallet may possibly hurt because you just bought a bunch of stuff you most likely don't need.

poi.name: Emperor's Garden Chinese Restaurant
poi.text: this is the Chinese place near my boyfriends house and we come here frequently food is inexpensive and plentiful and I am very picky with Chinese food but this place is delicious and the employees are really nice. I recommend it.

poi.name: Beekman's COPA Soaps
poi.text: I first bought these soaps at a kiosk at the Pennsylvania Flower Show now we make it known that every year we go to the kiosk. I love this soap and with my sensitive skin it does not irritate it, and it smells so good, you get a big whiff of it walking into the bathroom. I never been to the factory on Girard but I do want too.

poi.name: The Black Sheep Pub & Restaurant
poi.text:
My favorite happy hour spot. Discovered how amazing all the appetizers are back in summer 2011 center city sips (great time to check out all the different center city happy hour spots). The mac & cheese is great!

They have a great selection of beers on tap and bottles. The food is superb! If you're looking for a private party space, they have a cozy basement space with a personal bar. Only thing is occasionally you'll have some crashers who want to use the ATM and restroom (even though there is one on the second floor and 2 on the 3rd)

Just go! You won't be disappointed

poi.name: Porcini
poi.text: Food was well prepared and fresh. I had the oso bucco ravioli. The ravioli were definitely homemade, they were a little light on the filling which made them less flavourful then they should have been. Service was great,  the place was so loud the wait staff had a hard time hearing us unless we raised our voice. Good place. Extremely tiny and tables are jammed in. Not recommended for a date night. With so many great places to eat in this neighborhood the only thing that would bring me back is the fact it's bring your own bottle. Otherwise I know I could find something as good or better with less noise, a tad more elbow room, and more flavor

poi.name: El Camino Real
poi.text: At first I thought the prices here were pretty decent, but then I realized that they charge for every add on- chips/salsa, rice and beans, etc. I would be fine with this if the food was exceptional, but it is subpar. Both times I've been here, my side order of rice has been hard and dry, and burritos sad and limp. Additionally, the waitress we've had the two times going there had a horrible attitude. The only thing that saves this place is the guac, and the strong margaritas. Their strategy must be to get people drunk enough to not care about what they're eating and the rude service.

poi.name: Bleu Sushi
poi.text: Great atmosphere, never too crowded and the sushi is really good. It's a nice trendy place, + BYO!! The rolls named after Philly streets/places are a nice touch. I've been here several times and will go back again.

poi.name: Top Tomato Bar & Pizza
poi.text: 3.5 stars because they don't serve alcohol (and I was in dire need of a drink after a veryyyy long week). Get the margherita pie - it is delicious and fresh. Also ordered the Greek salad for an appetizer which was filled with yummy veggies. Yum.

poi.name: Porcini
poi.text:
I am so surprised that I haven't reviewed Porcini yet. I would give it 5 stars if it wasn't so crowded on a weekend night (so I'll give it 4.5).

Even though it can get crowded on a weekend night, I think the coziness of the restaurant adds to why I like it. I feel like I am eating in someone's dining room and everyone is so friendly. You can't go wrong with the gnocchi and their specials are always delicious. The calamari is great too (and not fried). 

Credit cards are accepted which is nice for a BYOB...this is one of my favorite italian BYOBs in the city.

poi.name: Ants Pants Café
poi.text:
Great breakfast spot when you are looking for something in between diner food and a big fancy brunch with mimosas. Went there again this past weekend and they currently have homemade apple cider with cinnamon. It was freaking amazing. Also, I love their fresh squeezed OJ as does my boyfriend who refuses to order his own glass and ends up drinking half of mine. Every. damn. time.

But I digress. The ham, brie, egg, and avocado sandwich on a croissant is my go-to. Eggs benedict is good but there are better items on the menu such as the bacon stack which is great bread, arugula, egg, bacon, tomato and pecorino romano. I love their bread and they actually sell it for $9-10 a loaf. A little pricey but it's damn good.

My only complaint is the size of the place. I always try to get a spot outside which is heated when it's cold out.

poi.name: Pub & Kitchen
poi.text:
James L. you MUST get the dessert next time. The banana bread pudding is amazing and my boyfriend and I went to pub and kitchen solely for this item last night. AND...best of all, the chef gave us our dessert for free. I have no idea why but I think it might have something to do with the fact that we were shoving the bread pudding in our mouths when he came over to ask us how we liked it and I couldn't answer him right away because my mouth was too full. That's my guess.

Anyway, I am a huge fan of pub and kitchen. I love the warm and cozy atmosphere, the burgers are good, and the fries w/aoili dipping sauce are addicting.

poi.name: Village Whiskey
poi.text: 3.5 stars. Don't get me wrong - the duck fat fries are delicious and the burgers were tasty as well but two things keep this from being a 4 or 5 star rating: 1) the wait is always ridiculous, and 2) my damn burger fell apart as I tried to eat it. The burger is HUGE. Be careful with how much alcohol you order because before you know it, you've spent over 100 bucks on dinner for two (and you just ordered burgers and fries).

poi.name: Branzino Italian Ristorante
poi.text: I had a great experience dining here for the first time on Friday night with my boyfriend and another couple. The service was impeccable and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend the mussels and the gnocchi sorrento (homemade gnocchi in red sauce topped with fresh mozz). It's BYOB and accepts credit cards which seems to be a rare combination. I will definitely be going back.

poi.name: South Philadelphia Tap Room
poi.text: Holy fried chicken and cornbread heaven. After taking a bite of the huge piece of cornbread that came with four generous sized portions of crispy, perfectly seasoned pieces of fried chicken, my boyfriend declared that "this is the best cornbread I have ever had." After he said that, I pounced on it and tried to shove as much as possible in my mouth. He was right. It was moist (I HATE that word but that's the only way to describe it), full of flavor and had a bit of a kick. I also tried a bite of my friend's burger (delicious) and some fried pickles (also delicious). I love the atmosphere here - dark, warm, inviting, and a good amount of outdoor seating. I am told that brunch is just as good as dinner...I will be back for the cornbread.

poi.name: Cantina Dos Segundos
poi.text:
Yum, yum, yum. Went here with a big group to celebrate a friend's birthday. The staff really handled the large group well (there were over 20 of us) and everyone enjoyed their food.

The margaritas were excellent, the chips and salsa were endless, and my mahi mahi tacos were fresh and filling. It also wasn't that expensive at ALL (the pitcher of margarita was a very good investment).

I also really enjoy the atmosphere and the fact that it's a short walk to North Bowl.

poi.name: Devlin Collision Center
poi.text: Best auto body shop in Philadelphia in my opinion. My Honda Fit had accumulated all sorts of nicks, dents, scratches, and even some really ugly lime deposit stains on the hood of my car. I took it to Devlin's to get touched up, and what I got back was a car that looked like it just rolled off the assembly line. Honestly, if I told you my car was 3 years old and had gone through a few scrape-ups, I don't think you'd be able to tell. Ed Devlin is a miracle worker, and he does his magic at a super affordable price... I was shocked at how inexpensive the bill came out to be.

poi.name: All About Hair
poi.text: Is there any way that I can give a sixth or even seventh star to this place? Perhaps I'll contact the Yelp! corporate offices in San Francisco to inquire about expanding the star system using Lou and All About Hair as the Exhibit A. I've been on a three year odyssey, which has included some of the worst haircuts and barbers this side of, well, anything, to find a place like All About Hair. It is simply fantastic. I was here early on a Friday morning and aside from doing an incredible to the follicles that rest atop my head, Lou provided fantastic conversation and an environment that was more than inviting. I haven't written a Yelp! review in a very long time, but after my experience at All About Hair, I felt compelled to fire off a five star review about this gem of a place. Needless to say, I've found my barber of choice and they've made a long-term customer out of me.

poi.name: Children's Hospital of Philadelphia
poi.text:
Updating previous trip- I still would take my kids there but the derma bond sucked. Poor buddy has a scar. Yea, yea...it's in a bad spot. And he's not quite two (read: squirmy.) 

I don't think it's too much to want it all. 

 :-/

poi.name: Foodery
poi.text:
Small joint but good beer selection. I picked up two brews for the hubs bday and it came to $27!!!
 
One was the tall boy- Sah'tea Dogfish. I expected expensive but not THAT expensive. It was $20 alone.

I love the foodery- good location and good rotating options for beers and snacks.

poi.name: Citizens Bank Park
poi.text:
This is the locatiion of my very last first date. CBP is good. Sunken field, good beer selection and helpful staff. Very romantic.

My favorite seats are the VERY last row up in the 400 section on the first base line whet it's hot. If you're lucky enough to get that last row, not only can you see the entire field, but you also get a bitching breeze coming off the river.

First game? Swing by guest services to get a certificate signed by the skipper.

Now two kids deep havent seen much baseball since our little birds like the playground in the Phanatic Zone. I also hear hot dogs in tat section are ALWAYS $1. I keep forgetting to test this theory. Check it out and hollar at me.

poi.name: Children's Hospital of Philadelphia
poi.text:
Welp, can't complain. Not about one thing. 

My son took a spill and got a gash under his lip. Our peeds doctor suggested we go to the ER for a second opinion about stitches- he's just under two and stitches in the face for a little one mean sedation- need to be at a hospital for that. With CHOP nearby (we live a lucky half hour outside of the city) I'm not going anywhere else. 

It was a slow Saturday morning so they got us right in. Overall we were there for under two hours. Before heading back to be evaluated by the nurse they had coloring books, crayons, interactive toys, wagons and all sorts of other things kinds like, nay, need to be amused. 

As soon as we got back I asserted my Mommy-ness and said we wanted to see a plastic surgeon if face stitches were needed and the lovely nurse assured me we'd do whatever we needed to close him up. 

The doctors came in shortly after and looked at my BB- both agreed that the small laceration would heal nicely with dermabond and that stitched would be more traumatic for Maksi than they were worth- but that they'd be happy to do it if that's what we wanted. We went with the Dermabond.

While we waited for the procedure, a Child Life Specialist (I think that was her title) came in to find out what my kid's favorite toy was (we love Thomas the Train) and came back with an armful of cleaned toys AND a Thomas DVD for the room. 

Dermabond procedure was quick- they came back with our paperwork and answered all of our questions about iderma bond and saliva (homeboy is a major drool-monster) and we were out. 

Aside from being the most well known docs in the area- the customer service was astounding. I rarely dish out five star reviews but since it came to the fruit of my loins, I felt this one was worth it. 

They provided fantastic service and that helped him be a fantastic patient. 

Bravo, CHOP ER, you done good.

poi.name: Please Touch Museum
poi.text:
I can't believe I've never written a view for PTM. We've been there countless times and started going about six months ago. Our oldest kid is 23 months and it's getting more fun for him each time we head there. Little guy isl sticks to blowing milk bubbles in my sling.

I reeeeally think it's over-priced...unless you're a member- which we are- and we go frequently to make the most of it. And since we're pros we get their early. My husband is often one of the first to enter when he takes the kiddies while I work. 

Children over one have to pay the $15 admission and they're really too little for even the little kid sections. So that's a rip. Whatever- it's much better now for our boo who's nearly two. Another membership benny is discounts at the gift shop and cafeteria where they serve bologna and chee sammies, REALLY deeelish wood oven pizza, and other things that kids like. 

There are plenty of places for little guys to run and play. There are also plenty of places for bigger kids to elbow them out of the way so watch out for them and their helicopter parents. 

It gets really crowded, really fast- especially on school holidays and rainy days. Also, Sprout hosts frequently make appearances so they are busy. Tuesdays have been the best for me- and after lunch closer to most people's nap times gets better too. 

Make sure you're on your game when you go- you'll need a nap after.

poi.name: Allegro Pizza
poi.text:
Allegro's is great. The pizza is really cheap, and lightning fast. My favorite was the sicilian, followed by the, uh, meaty kind, followed in a close third by anything stuffed (sometimes the centers were cold). They also sell beer, but I can't comment much on that because when I lived in Philadelphia I was under 21.
The only downside is the service (occasionally rude) and the constant crazies that hang out there talking to themselves.

poi.name: Boyds Philadelphia
poi.text:
Boyd's is the Bergdorf's of Philadelphia.
The legions of attendants are polite and very willing to help. They pay attention to you no matter how you are dressed or how much money you came to spend.
The decor is amazing, the floors expansive. 

Oh yeah, and there's a cafe by a world-class chef inside of it.

poi.name: Pub & Kitchen
poi.text: Two very good experiences.  Excellent burger and very good pulled pork.  Wife loved her egg white and goat cheese omlette.  Solid beer list and a good spicy bloody Mary.  Also had great service and an ecclectic play list.

poi.name: Parc
poi.text: I'll just keep this simple.  If you don't like Parc, you're fussy and should check yourself.  Amazing spot for brunch, lunch, drinks, and dinner (although probably better for the 1st 3).

poi.name: South Street Cleaners
poi.text:
The lady who works here is a miracle worker! I came in with a couple pairs of pants that needed to be hemmed, and a suit jacket whose sleeves needed to be shortened (both of which are not quick and easy, since suits are normally lined and it's a lot of work). I also needed it to be done fast - I was leaving the country the next day. Not only did she do all of these alterations in a day, they were also excellently done - neat and professional - and now I have a beautiful suit that fits me brilliantly for my business trip! Plus, they take all credit cards - including Amex! - and have very reasonable hours. 

Definitely returning.

poi.name: La Colombe Coffee
poi.text:
Yo this draft latte is BS good. 

Also the guy at the register complimented my tie. 10/10

poi.name: Village Whiskey
poi.text: Best burger I've had. Fries aren't as great as I hope, but my expectations were really high. Wide selection of drinks available too.

poi.name: Federal Donuts
poi.text: Good donuts, juicy chicken, and real friendly staff. Za'taar and ranch seasonings are good picks.

poi.name: Terakawa Ramen
poi.text: Pretty good. Can't remember the taste of ippudo, but this is the closest I've had to authentic ramen I think. Takoyaki isn't bad, but the filling is a bit small. Chicken bun is worth it though. Prices for ramen range around $9-11

poi.name: Smiley's Cafe
poi.text: Seriously one of the most pleasant dining experiences I have had in a while. Smiley himself is a true gem and the food was DELICIOUS. Had so much that I am eating it for lunch again today - and I can't wait! Please recommend to everyone you know in Manayunk, don't want to lose this place!

poi.name: Midas
poi.text: Wish I could give zero stars. Not only are they shady, but they are rude. I went in for an inspection, paid the hundreds of dollars to fix whatever they said. Realized after I had left they wrote the wrong number on my sticker - off by thousands of miles. Then I drove a total of 20 miles and my check engine light went off. Went back and the front desk guy Corey told me they couldn't change the stickers, even though it was their mistake. He argued with me about it for a while. Then his manager came out and realized his employee is a liar and said they could. Fixed the stickers but when I called mid-day to ask about the check engine light, Corey rudely told me I needed a tune-up and it was done. No price. When I picked it up, there was no charge and they would not say what was wrong with the car. Turned the car on - check engine light on. Went back in, Corey hid in the back and had the woman at the front desk say it was something that needed to be fixed at the dealer. Then when I asked WHAT needed to be fixed she fished a piece of paper out of the trash and gave it to me. Apparently I just needed new spark plugs but I offended their little egos too much with making them fix their mistake that they sent me on my way with a car about to break down. Also, definitely not a dealership issue. So unbelievably rude and nasty.

poi.name: The Original Hot Dog Factory
poi.text: Got the Detroit coney (chili and cheese) and it was great. But the fries were phenomenal! Great lunch spot.

poi.name: Trattoria Carina
poi.text: By far my favorite restaurant in Philly right now. My relationship with Trattoria Carina actually began with takeout during quarantine, which I was nervous wouldn't live up to the hype. But boy was I wrong. Every time I get takeout it's incredible. Then actually going (sitting outdoors on their cutely decorated corner) was great!! No reservations right now which makes it tricky, but it's worth it. I highly recommend following them on Instagram the new pastas are always on there and they're always beautiful and delicious.

poi.name: Porcini
poi.text: Horrible experience. It's small and loud, which is to be expected from a center city byob but it was everything else that was really awful. They bring out a disgusting mix of ricotta and oil with no explanation (thought it was rotten butter until we asked), the waitress asked if she could 'get this shit out of here' inquiring if she could clear our plates, food was all around gross. Then there was a group who had finished dinner and was just drinking who were watching videos and singing along LOUDLY to each song. This went on for at least 4-5 songs with staff all around. No one said anything to them. All around one of the worst dinner experiences in my 10 years in Philadelphia. Spend your money elsewhere.

poi.name: Tomo Sushi & Ramen
poi.text: I was craving for Ramen when I found this gem, but it wasn't the Ramen that I'm rating here (it falls a bit short comparing to the Ramens I've had in NY). That Steven roll!!! That was one of the best rolls that I've had! Good thing I was pretty hungry and asked for roll recommendations. I was definitely not disappointed. I would love to come back once I visit Philly again.

poi.name: The Sultans of Schlep
poi.text:
I worked with the Sultans of Schlep last week on a small move within center city. I had a great experience for a number of reasons:

-Tom is extremely attentive, responsive, and easy to work with
-They have fair prices
-The movers were on time and worked efficiently
-They provided wardrobe boxes at no extra cost
-They have a cool and funny name (don't you think?)

I would definitely work with them again!

poi.name: Southgate
poi.text: I am really happy about this addition to our neighborhood - Southgate has a cute, intimate feel with a unique menu. I came here on a Friday night with my boyfriends and was able to sit outside without a wait. To drink, I had the white sangria; a bit too sweet for my taste but good nonetheless. I probably wouldn't get it again because it wasn't cheap ($9). For an appetizer, we ordered the dumplings, which were delicious! The beef on the inside was so flavorful, I could have eaten 50 of them. There are five dumplings, so you can split them with another person as a small appetizer. For an entree, my boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sandwich. He wasn't crazy about the sandwich but we both loved his spicy fries. Very interesting addition. I got the bibimbap with beef. I loved it! My only qualm was that it came out cold. I asked for it to be heated up and they were happy to oblige, but it still came out lukewarm after that. I might try it in the stone pot next time. Otherwise, it was really flavorful with just a little kick which I loved. The service was also really good - our waitress was very attentive, friendly, and polite. I will say it is a little pricey, but not any more so than comparable restaurants in the area. Overall, I really enjoyed this place and will definitely be coming back!

poi.name: The Sultans of Schlep
poi.text: I moved again this past week and didn't want to go with anyone other than the Sultans. Tom accommodated my schedule on a day that wasn't good for him and the movers were as great as I remembered from the last time. They arrived early and finished the job incredibly quickly. They were easy to work with and especially helpful. I told them I was selling my couch, and Noah so kindly took a photo of it and said he would send it to a friend he thought may want it. I highly recommend this company to anyone that wants a seamless move. They made an extremely stressful process just a bit less stressful by making my move perfect! Not that I ever want to move again in the near future; but if I do I will definitely be using the Sultans.

poi.name: Anthropologie
poi.text:
This is a beautiful store at which I've had mixed experiences.

The store itself is gorgeous- it's across from Rittenhouse park, beautifully decorated, organized nicely, and always smells like their delicious candles...

When you walk in, the first floor is really inviting, with clothing, bags, beauty products, and candles. Downstairs is housewares and BHLDN (their bridal line). I would highly recommend making an appointment, even if you are just browsing for bridesmaid gear, because I went in once looking for just that and they were extremely unhelpful to me.

I don't feel like they have the most friendly staff, but I don't let that deter me because they are a really busy location and they have a lot of foot traffic coming in and out. I feel sometimes their lines are long and you're left to wait around, but some of that is other customers being slow and unaware.

The clothing is expensive, but they have a fairly robust sale section on the top floor that is usually discounted on top of the sale price. The dressing rooms are also very inviting and comfortable, well maintained, and clean.

I don't think retail, especially in this location, is a simple task, and anthro does it well. I think I'd step up the customer service for the prices, but otherwise I do like this store.

poi.name: Doggie Style Pets
poi.text:
As a very recent puppy owner, living near Doggie Style Fishtown is really a gift. It's conveniently located on Frankford Ave, and they have a very friendly and approachable staff. They also have a groomer that operates on a walk-in basis which is super convenient.

I recommend Doggie Style for more last-minute needs, as it can be kind of pricey. They have a great selection of leashes, toys, bones/bully sticks, and treats, just to name a few. I will definitely keep coming back here to shop and get advice from their super friendly workers!

poi.name: Buena Onda
poi.text:
I used to LOVE Buena Onda. I currently like it. There are a couple of reasons for this...

I used to consistently get the "chop salad" with chicken. I absolutely loved it. It was literally the perfect salad, and the chicken was prepared perfectly. I probably ordered it 10-20 times for my main (my boyfriend and I love ordering from here on Caviar or for pickup). Then, I slowly noticed changes....sometimes the salad was missing an ingredient or two.  Then, one day, the chicken was completely different, and I hated it! I was so disappointed. I called and they said they just changed the recipe. I let them know I was sad to hear it.

A similar thing happened to my boyfriend, who became obsessed with two menu items that subsequently changed. He loved the ingredients and then, poof, they no longer offered these items or they changed them up.

There have been a few times our Caviar order has gotten messed up, which I can't say for sure whose fault it was; but it was annoying nonetheless.

The positives are, most of the menu has been consistently great. The fish tacos are some of the best I've had. I love the nachos, guac, and salsa. I find the guac to be pretty overpriced, but I know avocados can be expensive so I accept it.

My advice to the restaurant is to please stop changing your menu! People come back for the consistency of good food, and it's no fun when your favorite items are no longer there.

poi.name: Golden Chopstick Chinese Restaurant
poi.text:
If you're looking for solid, budget-friendly takeout Chinese food, this is your spot. Especially during the current covid-19 crisis - they have takeout and delivery available with easy and safe pickup.

Over the past few years, I have been there somewhere between 10 and 20 times, and I've always been happy with my order. The restaurant itself is not in the greatest condition, so I recommend takeout or delivery. They have a very user friendly website for ordering, which I appreciate for ease, especially right now.

Yes, this place isn't fancy, but the food is consistently good, they have great prices, and they are reliable in the sense that my orders are always correct and made on time.

I recommend the wonton soup, chicken and broccoli, any of the lo mein, and the fried chicken wings. My boyfriend loves these even though they are most definitely not Chinese food :)

I will keep supporting this business knowing they are working hard to make good, affordable food, especially during this time!

poi.name: Midas
poi.text: I needed my car inspected and they take appointments, unlike MANY other places in the city who either don't take appointments or don't pick up their phone at all. They took me on time and finished on time. No nonsense.

poi.name: Xochitl
poi.text:
Xochitl is a really good spot to sit outside on a nice summer/fall night. It's right in Headhouse square, and it's so nice to sit on the sidewalk out there and enjoy dinner and a few drinks. It was easy to make a reservation last minute for 5 people on a Saturday night, and we got a table outside, so that's a big plus.

We were seated on time and our server was attentive. I loved the guac card that you could personalize too! The guac was good and the chips were solid- nothing out of the ordinary but not too salty (too much salt is no good for me). I ordered the chicken enchilada and really enjoyed it. It didn't taste heavy or fatty even though it had a good amount of sauce. The only thing I didn't love was my drink, but I got a basic gin cocktail and that's not their specialty so I didn't care much.

After tax and tip the bill was a bit pricier than I had expected, and I believe there are other places to get Mexican that are just as good and not as pricey. However, the service and location are great so Xochitl is somewhere I will likely return.

poi.name: El Camino Real
poi.text: Hands down the best veggie wings I've had anywhere. Seriously. I can never stop thinking about them. Their fried pickles are also great, though I've found their drinks to be a bit weak. I'll stick to a Mexican coke whenever I'm here.

poi.name: Khyber Pass Pub
poi.text: Service here was quick and friendly but it was really slow while I was there so who knows if it's always that quick. The menu caters to everyone - vegans, vegetarians, and carnivores. I don't recall any gluten free options but don't quote me on that. The atmosphere is okay but they had way more seating than I expected from the entrance. I ordered the vegan sausage sandwich and I thought it was pretty good. I would probably go back at some point.

poi.name: HipCityVeg
poi.text: Oh my goodness - this is what vegan food should be. I don't know how they do it, but this is one of the only places where fake meat doesn't make me nauseas. Unfortunately, I live in LA, and while you'd assume there's great vegan food here, you'd be wrong. Places like hipcityveg really put Philly on the vegan/foodie map.  I crave this place all the time and can never find a decent substitute for the crispy hipcity ranch. Please expand so vegans and foodies everywhere can enjoy your menu!!!

poi.name: Lloyd Whiskey Bar
poi.text: I was really excited to go here for brunch one day after looking over the menu online. I am a vegan due to food allergies and I saw they had vegan pancakes and sausage on the menu. When I showed up it was a different menu altogether and there wasn't anything vegan on it. They were very accommodating and ended up having the ingredients to make vegan pancakes, but it would have been easier if hey updates their menu or stated somewhere that it was seasonal. Parking can be a pain I that area. We had reservations but even though it was a large group for brunch at nooning a Sunday, we could probably have done without reservations. I would go back here if I knew for sure there would be someone thing I could eat. The service was really good and their Bloody Mary was really good too.

poi.name: Plume Salon
poi.text: This is my favorite hair salon in Philly.  It is reasonably priced, all organic, and so cute. The waiting area is really comfortable, and they always offer you something to drink while you wait and are in the chair. Love sipping on green tea while someone plays with my hair. I've always had a different stylist, and have never been disappointed.  I don't love that they're closed on Sundays, but it is what it is. Parking is a PAIN, so take public transit or get dropped off, lol. I never wait long, and have always had an easy time getting an appointment.

poi.name: Federal Donuts
poi.text: Parking can be a bit of a struggle, and if you don't show up early enough, there's a good chance they will be out of what you want.  The fancy donuts are cool, I guess, but the hot donuts are awesome.  Seriously, they're the way to go.  The vanilla spice is my favorite, so far.  I'm a vegetarian, so I cannot comment on the chicken, but I'd bet it's great.

poi.name: Howl At the Moon Philadelphia
poi.text: This place is only as good as the music they're playing. It's crowded and expensive and the age range is everything from 21 to like 65. Probably not going back.

poi.name: Village Whiskey
poi.text: I don't know why you would ever go to Shake Shack with this across the street. First of all, the atmosphere is great. It's a bit cramped, but it is what it is. I am a vegetarian, so I got the veggie burger, naturally. Now, don't get me wrong, it was great, but I don't know why it says "vegetarians go nuts for this place" because I'm pretty sure that's the only thing I could get on the menu. You can't even get most of the apps. But oh man, those shakes. To. Die. For. I would def go back, even though I'd be forced to get the same thing.

poi.name: Cantina Dos Segundos
poi.text: Best Mexican place in Philly. Sorry El Vez and Distrito. The menu is great because there are tons of options, no matter if you're a meat-eater, vegetarian, or vegan. Their burritos are huge, and their empanadas are delicious. But my god their margaritas are perfect. Seriously, I doubt you can find a better one anywhere. All of their flavors are great.  If you don't go back for dinner AND drinks then we're not on speaking terms.

poi.name: Crazy Sushi
poi.text:
Zero stars for the Chicken Teriyaki Lunch Bento Box.  I have literally never seen a bento box come without rice before.  

Disappoint.

poi.name: Kimpton Hotel Monaco Philadelphia
poi.text: Good price, great location and good accommodations with decently sized rooms. The bed is pretty firm though and the sheets are super rough but overall, I would stay here again!

poi.name: Lazos Pizza & Grill
poi.text: The pizza was the best we've had in the Fairmount/Art Museum/Brewerytown area and we've probably tried 5 or so.  The pepperoni was a little crispy (good thing) and the wings were, too.  That last one is really surprising since there are so many soggy wings out there.  Lazos does it right.  They gave me Sprite instead of Coke but otherwise this was a very good pizza+wing combo.  Will order again!

poi.name: SPOT Gourmet Burgers
poi.text: I love these burgers.  The fries are pretty good, too.  Don't even get me started on the cheese steaks.  Try to go during daylight hours.  The street is a little on the rough side.  Fitting more than one baby in there who needs a high chair is pretty tough.

poi.name: Lucky Goat Coffeehouse
poi.text: The staff are really friendly and make wicked delicious la coulombe coffee drinks.  We go here at least once per week.  A cute area in back if you want to study or play with your baby while you guzzle your caffeine.  Outside seats are usually full and scums will beg for cash, cigarettes, etc while you sit out there but you're still lucky to find a seat esp on a weekend.

poi.name: Termini Bros Bakery
poi.text: I love these sweets so much.  The staff aren't nearly as friendly or knowledgeable as the old school Passayunk location so if you have a choice, go there, instead.  Canolli, biscotti, and pecan bars are the best!  Worth the high prices.

poi.name: Honey's Sit-N-Eat
poi.text: The food is great, service is good and the wait wasn't sooo awful.  Make sure to keep bothering the hostess about your place in line and you'll get seated more quickly.  We chowed down on a variety of pancake, omelette, and other yummy breakfast.  Plus the coffee was fresh and strong, just like me.  Muaaahhhaha!

poi.name: Sabrina's Café
poi.text: Staff are nice.  Room for my baby.  Breakfasts are good sized, well priced, and delicious.  Just don't order anything with weird sounding ingredient combos on the specials menu.  The chef's 'creative' food mixes are kinda gross.  Just go with traditional breakfast and you'll be very happy.

poi.name: La Colombe Coffee
poi.text: As you can see from the photos, this shop is beautiful.  If I lived nearby, I would go to this location daily.  I often make it out on the weekend, though.  The cold brew nitrogen tank coffee drinks are the best coffee drinks I've ever had.  So smooth and delicious!  One of these days, I need to try their rum.  Pretzels are not traditional but very good...if you get a fresh one.  Cashiers are very nice, too.

poi.name: 7-Eleven
poi.text:
I don't know this for sure, but my first impression of this place is that it is run by unscrupulous people. Come along with me, as I journey back in time -- all the way back to Wednesday...

I step foot in this 7 Eleven, and the first thing I think is: this is one of the nicest looking 7 Elevens I've ever seen. It is very clean, bright, and spacious. Very nice looking selection of prepared meals. There were many that actually looked like they'd be quite good. But I wasn't hungry this day. No. All I needed were a few items. 

First, some good old TP. And let me be perfectly clear (as clear as Barack Obama): I DON'T buy the cheapest toilet paper because I'm cheap. I buy it because I like the way the cheap stuff feels. The more like sandpaper, the better. I like to feel like its working. I don't need to or even want to feel like an angel is up there. Or some perverted freak named Scott. 

In any case, I got myself 4 rolls. And then I just needed one more thing - some plastic cups for a little party I'm having this weekend. 

I go ahead and drop my stash on the counter, begin to extract several singles from my wallet, when the cashier looks at me and says, "24.99."

I respond, "That's not right."

He points at a price tag on the plastic cups which reads 19.99. I begin laughing. I tell him the price is clearly wrong. He tells me he's got to talk to his manager. Meanwhile, I tell the folks behind me waiting in line that I'm just going to go run and get different plastic cups to hurry the process along. Before he got back from doing his price check, I already had another cashier ringing up my two sleeves of cups for 1.99 each. That's more like it.

At around that same moment, the first cashier comes back from his consultation with his manager. He tells me that the price was, in fact, incorrect. And that the price is actually 14.99.

THAT'S the unscrupulous part.

CLEARLY, THAT price is also far too high. His manager did no actual price check at all. He simply told the cashier to pretend that the real price was actually 5 dollars less, thinking that I'd be stupid enough to accept this. Why, because I'm white, and you're a racially superior Indian? You think white people are stupid don't you? We'll just believe what you tell us, and fork over our money.

poi.name: John's Water Ice
poi.text:
Calories and diabetes be damned - fewer things could be better than gelati on days as brutally hot as the ones we've had this week.  Thanks for helping to cool us all down w your frozen treats.  Five stars for you.

PS - visit the website for a little Vanilla Ice.

poi.name: 30th Street Station
poi.text: Classic Northeastern rail station and way better than New York's awful Penn Station.  Don't forget that lazy Penn and Drexel employees can take the SEPTA LUCY bus to various points in University City.

poi.name: Rittenhouse Hardware
poi.text:
It's definitely handy to have a hardware store within walking distance of southwest Center City.  I'd called ahead of time to make sure they carried mesquite wood chips and the guy who answered the phone was pretty friendly.  Not surprisingly, though, there aren't many choices on inventory.

They also sharpen knives, but not while you wait.  Plan on dropping off your knife and then picking it up the next day.  No biggie.

poi.name: Citizens Bank Park
poi.text: Awesome venue to watch an equally awesome team.  Ticket prices are not nearly as outrageous as the cost of food inside the park, but no different from most stadiums.  Go Phils.

poi.name: Honey's Sit-N-Eat
poi.text: I'm neither Southern nor Jewish, but I really liked this place.  I used to get up to Northern Liberties much more frequently, but not so much anymore.  Regardless, while it's worth the wait, I'd go at an off-peak time so you're not stuck in the frequently LONNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNG lines.

poi.name: Jong Ka Jib
poi.text: Best soon-doo-boo in the city!  Even better than T.G.I. Friday's.

poi.name: El Camino Real
poi.text:
Came here twice in a month - on a Friday night and a Thursday evening before a long holiday weekend.  Though the food was below average, it was a nice place to get a drink, especially nice to sit outside on a summer evening.  

The beef short rib sandwich was awful.  It was very fatty and there was very little meat.  

The banana pudding was mediocre - at $7, it was pricey for what you get.  It didn't taste much different from Jello pudding and it did not come with the Mexican chocolate as listed in the menu.

Margaritas were great.

poi.name: Wawa
poi.text: This place is pretty well-run - it's always clean, they throw salt down outside when it's snowing, there's always plenty of coffee (only 79 cents for a refill if you bring your own mug), and the staff is friendly.  It's a nice option for breakfast or lunch in a part of University City when you're tired of the food trucks on Market between 36th and 34th.

poi.name: El Camino Real
poi.text: Came back again for lunch on July 5 and was underwhelmed again.  In addition to pitching in as bartenders, the two servers on duty seemed understaffed for the number of tables (at least 12-14) they were waiting on.  As a result, they were both reactive and could not do much more than fulfill requests by the various tables.  One table did not get cleaned nor cleared for over 30 minutes and sat dirty which made the flies happy as they got to eat their fill.

poi.name: El Camino Real
poi.text:
All you can drink brunch? Yes please!

Sat and Sun they got brunch item and unlimited bloody marys or mimosas for $20. Perfect for some Sunday Funday. Enjoy!

poi.name: Las Cazuelas Restaurant BYOB
poi.text:
BYO mexican spot in Northern Liberties

Came for brunch and the service was great. Food was delicious. I'm a fan of chorizo and they highlight chorizo a lot in their dishes.

Bring some tequila and order some margarita mix.

poi.name: Honey's Sit-N-Eat
poi.text:
Great brunch spot in Northern Liberties. 

Place is always packed - so get there early or be prepared to wait.

Huevos Rancheros - had a nice twist to the Mexican classic. Very addicting.

Honey Cristo Sandwich - ham and cheese sandwich with French Toast bread and an egg on top. Lots of flavor - sweet and salty.

OJ was fresh squeezed and delicious.

Cash only.

poi.name: Xochitl
poi.text:
The food here is pretty solid but the prices can be steep, especially if you're ordering a bunch of margaritas.

If you're looking for affordable and divey, check out all the Mexican joints near 9th and Washington.

But they do offer some inventive dishes:

- Ceviche is pretty good
- Custom guacamole (try with black truffles)
- Tamales
- Fish or Brisket tacos

poi.name: Federal Donuts
poi.text:
Amazing fried chicken.

Amazing donuts.

A must-eat in Philly.

poi.name: Southgate
poi.text: Excellent korean fusion gastropub. KFC was on point. Bibimbap was really good as well as their kimchi burger. Inside is pretty chic but casual.

poi.name: Red Owl Tavern
poi.text: Came for brunch and it was pretty good. They have a deal to Bellinis for $18 (a bottle of champagne to share and a bunch of fruit mixers). The food was ok - its fairly pricey but not really that great (compared to other brunch options in the city. The location is great though - right next to Independence mall.

poi.name: Khyber Pass Pub
poi.text:
Khyber Pass Pub offers some great Cajun-style bar food and New Orleans staples. 

Muffaletta, catfish po boys, shrimp po boys, collard greens, and fried okra are all really good.

Brunch has some unique items - boudin and eggs, bananas foster French Toast, BBQ hash. Try the creole bloody mary!

poi.name: The Twisted Tail
poi.text: Southern inspired restaurant is great for Bourbon and southern favorites. Chicken and waffles are great for brunch. Definitely must try crawfish mac & cheese, pulled pork empanadas, shrimp and grits. Lots of good bourbon drinks too.

poi.name: Larry's Steaks
poi.text:
Decent steak/pizza/hoagie shop. Go with the house steak -- it has peppers, onions, mushrooms, and pepperoni on it.

Cheap and geared towards college kids.

poi.name: Buena Onda
poi.text: I love places that aim to do one thing well. Come here for fish tacos (baja style, fried with the batter) and their house beer (K38 pale ale by Yards). That is all.

poi.name: Penang
poi.text:
Penang and Banana Leaf are like the Pats and Genos of BYOB Malaysian restaurants in Philly.

The differences are subtle and largely unnoticeable. 

They are a BYOB and are open late (til Midnight). So it's a great place to have dinner and pre-game before going out. Plus they take credit card. Plus the food is awesome. What more can you want?

Came here with a group of 4. Food was great for sharing. We went with the cant-miss dishes:
- Roti Canai
- Chicken Satay
- Beef Rendang
- Mango Chicken

I need to explore their menu a bit more -- the table next to us ordered a whole fish boiled in a hot pot that looked awesome.

poi.name: Ants Pants Café
poi.text:
Ants pants is a staple of the Philly brunch scene.

Its a small joint that does American / Australian food.

Favorite items:
- Sweet potato hash with italian sausage
- The Stack
- Brekkie platter
- sweet potato fries

Get here early because the place fills up fast.

Minus 1 star because they tend to have poor/slow service like most hipster-y joints.

poi.name: Pub & Kitchen
poi.text:
British inspired gastropub.

It's tucked away a bit in Rittenhouse, but its a great place for a drink and meal.

Came for brunch:
- Banger sandwich -- this thing was awesome
- Mussels - the mussels here are giant; in a spicy chipotle sauce -  really hit the spot.

Definitely need to come back for dinner when they serve their famous burger (apparently its considered one of the best in Philly).

poi.name: Smiley's Cafe
poi.text:
Smiley's is a hidden jewel in Manayunk. The food is classic Greek / Turkish / Mediterranean. There are options for platters (served with rice, hummus, pita bread, and Greek salad), sandwiches/gyros, and sides. They also have banana bread, smoothies, and baklava if you're looking for dessert.

I recommend the gyro platter, falafel platter, and the schwarma sandwich (comes with a garlic tahini sauce).

BYOB plus you can smoke hookah there.

Pretty sure it is cash-only, although they may be accepting credit cards now. (bring cash just in case).

poi.name: Bistrot La Minette
poi.text:
Bistrot La Minette is an excellent choice for casual French fare with great service and ambiance. They even gave us a light puff pastry and chocolates complimentary.

- Escargot was very good, 9 pieces in individual little pots
- Tartare was quite flavorful
- Duck confit was amazing, cooked so well
- Rabbit with homemade tagliatelle was excellent as well

Great wine options for those with fancy palates. For those on a budget, the house wine was pretty decent and affordable, also with options for half bottle or full bottle.

Deserts looked great too.

poi.name: Greek Lady
poi.text:
Greek Lady has solid Greek/American fare at reasonable prices. 

Food here is decent if you stick to the main stuff (I recommend the gyro platter):
- Gyros are solid and hearty. They put fries inside which is nice. Quality is ok, but good for the price and size.
- Side salad was actually really good. Veggies were fresh, lots of feta, simple oil dressing
- Fries were good but nothing special (the rest of the sides are mediocre)

Portions are giant, which makes sense considering its vicinity to Penn and Drexel.

Service is pretty mediocre, especially the people at the counter who take your order - they are pretty apathetic (although the ladies who clean up are pretty nice).

poi.name: Cantina Dos Segundos
poi.text: Staple for food and drink on 2nd street in Northern Liberties. Brunch is very solid- try the breakfast burrito with chorizo or huevos dos segundos. Great happy hour too. Love the salsa verde.

poi.name: Greg's Kitchen
poi.text:
Down grading the rating at Gregs. This place is incredibly SLOW. I came when it first opened and just thought it was opening kinks, but even 2+ years after opening, they really struggle to put tater tots, eggs, and cheese in a bowl (yes that is how simple their "brekky" is, and they struggle to make it fast).

Not sure how they make any money since the space and seating is tiny - they constantly turn customers away because they can't make the food fast enough.

If you're coming before 10am you'll be ok, but you'll waste an hour and half waiting for tater tots and eggs during the weekend brunch rush. Really hope they are able to figure something out.

poi.name: Brauhaus Schmitz
poi.text:
Very good German food and beer on South Street. 

Highlights:
- Das Boot (beer in a boot, just like in Beerfest!!)
- Wienerschnitzel
- Potato pancakes
- Potato salad
- Bratwurst (1m long!)

Slightly dissapointed by the spaetzle.

They serve food late into the night (through 2am)

poi.name: Vietnam Restaurant
poi.text:
Yes there are better Vietnamese and Pho restaurants in South Philly, but most of them are hole-in-the-walls.

Vietnamese restaurant is in Chinatown (convenient location) and has a nice ambiance and full bar. The food is still really good - I recommend the house special Vermicelli.

poi.name: Capital Beer
poi.text: Good Chinese food and really nice beer selection.  Haven't tried the sushi yet, so I can't speak to that.  True, the staff isn't exactly the most cordial, but they're plenty nice enough for Chinese food take out.  This is not an expensive or fancy restaurant, so you should go in with reasonable expectations.

poi.name: Andre Richard Salon
poi.text:
The most amazing thing happened today.  I walked into Andres Richard Salon on Locust St for my appointment with Stephanie, a junior stylist at Andres.  We talked, I showed her pictures and the magic began.  I came in for a balayage, a fix from my existing washed out, brassy ombre.  Stephanie was so sweet, attentive and definitely catered to my request.  Hours later, my hair is exactly what I wanted!  I spent most of 2015 crying out of Salon after Salon.  This is will be the only person that will ever touch my hair again.
If you're looking for technical, creative, and expert hair care, you'll find it at Andres Richard.

poi.name: Oregon Beauty
poi.text: Terrible experience overall.  The place is spacious and clean but the staff is ill experience and rude.  I went for a pedicure yesterday and basically paid for a foot bath. They did a mediocre job.  Didn't attend to my cuticles and the paint job was terrible.  Her appointment came in half way through my pedicure and it showed that she could care less about doing a good job for the rest of my session.  Also, they speak Cantonese, so I'm guessing they assumed that I didn't understand when they were saying things about me.  Spend your money elsewhere.

poi.name: Violet Salon III
poi.text:
Terrible. 
I've been coming to this salon for over 10 years.  Bad manicures after bad pedicures,  over and over again, I stayed loyal.   They were the best in south philly at one point.   Their prices have gone up and the quality of work has declined.   Every time I make a small complaint, they respond with "its suppose to look like that".  
They've cut into my toes so badly that fungus started underneath my nails.  I've found a new salon on 9th and south street.   They've made every effort on righting the wrong that violet salon has done. 
I'm not writing this review after one incident,  it's been 2 years of bad service.  I can no longer come to this salon again and I'd advise everyone else to look for another place.
Start with boutique nails on 9th and south. 
Or posh in the small shipping center on 25th and Oregon across from ross.

poi.name: Apsara Cutting Edge
poi.text:
Avoid!!!!!
Only giving 1 star because I can't give any less. 
The staff is incredibly nice. 
Technique is lacking.  
After 2 days,  $300 and walking out of the salon with wet hair,  the last words that were said to me was "that's the best I can do".
Got it fixed at Fringe.

poi.name: Apsara Cutting Edge
poi.text:
I definitely would not recommend this salon. 
I spent 2 days and over $300 in this place which resulted in a very amateur coloring.   I had 4 different colors in my hair,  and not in a flattering way. 
The hair dresser completely botched my hair coloring and let me leave twice with wet hair.   
Which everyone knows you can not see actual hair color when it's wet. 
Upon leaving on the second day the hair dresser told me it's the best she can do and recommended that I come back in a few weeks to touch it up at a reduced rate of $75. 
Please do not go to this salon.   You'll wind up spending a lot of money to have it fixed elsewhere.

poi.name: Cafe Square One
poi.text: Cheap food and large selection. Unfortunately, they forgot our order, we waited 15 minutes and they were not even sorry about it. Bad customer service.

poi.name: Larry's Steaks
poi.text:
For a long, long time, Dallesandro's was my philly cheesesteak haven.  However, since their change in ownership, they've gone steadily downhill.  Chubby's and Mama's tided me over until I could find suitable replacement.  Thanks to Larry's Steaks, I've rekindled my passion for cheesesteaks.

Larry's Steaks, situated by St. Joe's University, offers the closest thing to the original Dallesandro's cheesesteak I've found.  The meat is sliced and minced into tiny little pieces, maximizing surface area.  Then the cheese is melted throughout so it covers most of the steak and ensures a heavenly consistency and flavor.  The onions and mushrooms are up to snuff as well.  It's greasy enough to slide down your throat but not so much that it's a mess to eat.  I can't attest to the other menu items, but that hardly matters.  If you are up for a real philly cheesesteak, skip pat's and geno's (and the whiz, i can't believe people actually eat that stuff) and pick up a Larry's steak.

poi.name: Philadelphia Flyers
poi.text: Wells Fargo is a great atmosphere for all ages. Flyers host a great game every time I got no matter where you sit. I would recommend everyone to a game even if you don't like hockey!!

poi.name: Top Tomato Bar & Pizza
poi.text: Ordered fresh made pie, not reheated slices.  Some of the best pizza I've had in philly, because of the tasteful and crunchy crust and good amount of toppings.  Had a Cowboy steak with no BBQ sauce and couldn't stop myself at two slices.  Got the same pizza again with bbq sauce and it was just as good so now I do half and half.

poi.name: Heads & Tails Beauty Boutique
poi.text: I just walked out of Heads and Tails and I can't  say enough about Jenne.  I was quite nervous to have a bikini wax and Jenne talked me though the whole process and it was not bad at all!  If you have sensitive skin and are looking for a clean place with an excellent staff - do not hesitate going here. Will be back!

poi.name: Octopus Falafel Truck
poi.text:
I am a groupie. He is amazing. I am sad that I got to have his dish only once. Now all construction on market I can't find him!!

His chicken is the most tender and smoky I've ever had. Side dishes are creative and awesome too. 
I hope he is back soon.

poi.name: Marathon
poi.text:
Eh, disappointing food. I saw this place got busy during lunch hour so gave a shot during weekday lunch. 
Place was busy and I saw people getting salad with salmon so I got that one as well. 
My salmon was dry... And lukewarm. Definitely didn't enjoyed my protein. I had only one visit so I can't speak for all but my salad wasn't fresh either that day. Sandwiches on other tables looked good though. That was my first and only trip to Marathon.

poi.name: Crazy Sushi
poi.text:
My sushi place hunt hasn't finished yet. We tried bonsai roll, one night stand roll, volcano roll and sashimi platter. They did put a lot of effort decorating the dishes. We were very hungry so rather getting dishes as soon as we can lol 
Even though I appreciated their beautiful decoration, sushi wasn't that impressive. I did enjoy one night stand roll but bonsai roll had too much cucumber. I like thin slice of cucumber just round once or twice otherwise I can't really taste any sashimi because cucumber has pretty strong scent itself. I felt like I had big chunk of cucumber after all..the quality of sashimi was ok but nothing extra ordinary. And the bill ended up not that cheap. I think I could find this quality food with less price.

poi.name: Pizzeria Vetri
poi.text:
Was on the way Petco me and my parents saw this place was empty. No line! We weren't very hungry but had to get a pizza here. 
I had high hope about this pizzeria since I just had amazing experience at Vetri. How good would be! And Philly does have great pizza overall, this one might be too good to me to handle.
